messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/4/2007 3:13:11 P.M. Central Standard Time, swords@usroute66.net writes: Milt...should I tempt you with a kurigata cover (copper-ish) of
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/4/2007 3:13:11 P.M. Central Standard Time,
swords@... writes:

Milt...should I tempt you with a kurigata cover (copper-ish) of Bat?
Hmmm...not iron though.

Ron
STL



ron, the bat f/k is on iron ishime ground.............

milt

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] help needed
messages.msgSnippet: Milt...should I tempt you with a kurigata cover (copper-ish) of Bat? Hmmm...not iron though. Ron STL ... From: bungotakadasword To:
messages.messageBody:
Milt...should I tempt you with a kurigata cover (copper-ish) of Bat? Hmmm...not iron though.

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: bungotakadasword
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, February 04, 2007 3:03 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] help needed


dudes and dudettes,
On the verge of finishing a restoration project on a wak.
koshirae.........
all that's missing is the kurigata ( the thing with the hole where the
cord passes through on the saya ).
I need an iron one , preferably with ishime ground, plain or with some
sort of insect to match the end cap with tambo on one side and
butterfly on the reverse.

The rest is bat f/k with moon, so rest of the stuffs are all somehow
moon related. I finally found a koz that ties in perfectly....... a
deer ( goes with the bat as fortune and longivity ) with moon.

So in case you all come across an iron kurigata at sword shows,
jukeboxes, e-bay etc. ect., kindly keep me in mind.

Danke,

milt





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
